alert.note: Alert for Petersburg Borough (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 01 at 9:55AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Falls Creek area near Petersburg. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM AKDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 947 AM AKDT, River gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain in areas around Falls Creek. Rapid river rises will cause minor flooding, especially near Falls Creek. Between 2.0 and 3.0 inch of rain has fallen since Friday afternoon. The expected rainfall rate is 0.4-0.8 inches in 3 hours. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.75 to 2 inches are possible through this afternoon. - For Falls Creek near Petersburg: At 9:00am the stage was 22.08 feet. Flood Stage is 22.5 feet.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
